bibl.title: Wiley v. Keokuk. Letter from Attorneys
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Keokuk Chief of the Sue & Fox Indians Plff vs Albert Wiley defts }
In the District Court of Douglas County Kansas. Motion for new trial.

And now come the said Albert Wiley by Riggs Norison & Fonte his attorneys and moves the court to set aside the verdict heretofore rendered in this case and to grand a new trial in this action for the following reasons
1st That the damages given of the jury in this case are excessive.

2 That the verdict of the jury given in this case is not sustained by the evidence nor by sufficient evidence and is against and contrary to the weight of the evidence and is against and contrary to the can of the case.
3 That the proceedings of the court were irregular in the impanelling the jury in this action in this to wit: That in impanelling the jury one Walter
Willis was called as a juror and was challenged by the defendant counsel for cause.

The cause of challenge given and assigned by the defendant counsel being that the said Walter Willis had served once already on a jury as a talesman on the trial of a cause in said court during the term thereof them being holden and the said Walter Willis on being challenged as aforesaid there and these stated in open court that he had so served as a talesman and which fact was also then and there proven by the Record of the Court and admitted by this court and the counsel for the plaintiff. Wherefore the court & proceeding irregular wereby the defendant was injured.
4 That is want used in his charge of he saw so the jury in this action.
5 That the court erned is refusing to charge the jury as requested by the defendant counsel.
The court then remased a judgement

in said action which upon the verdict of and jury which was as follows. It is therefor ordred and adjudged by the court here that the said plaintiff Keokuk do recover of and from the said defendant Albert Wiley the said sum of one thousand dollars his damages assessed aforesaid and that the said defendant all costs in and about the said expended taxed at $ and hereof best exclusion issue

That afterwards to wit: on the 21st day of may AD 1869 and at the same term of court at which said can't was tried as aforesaid said motion for a new trial came for having before said court. Whereupon James Christian Esq appeared as attorney for the plaintiff and Reggs Nerisor &Forte for the defendant Wiley and was argued by counsel and after hearing the arguments of counsel the court then and there overruled said motion for a new trial to which ruling of the court the said

defendant then and there duly excepted, and on motion of the defendant the court granted to said defendant until the 22d day of June AD 1869 to make and file a made case for the Supreme Court. That on the 22d day of June AD 1869 the said parties appeared by their respective attorneys in open Court and by agreement of said plaintiff and defendant by their attorneys the Court then and there extended the time in which the defendant was to make and file a made case for the Supreme Court to the 2d day of the next term of said Court.
We have examened the above and find the case made in every respects.
James Christian Atty for Ptff Riggs Nevison & Fonte Attys for Albert Wiley def
Allowed time having been extended in open court until this date Aug 19 1869. Caven A. Bassett
